messages.message: What does your header look like?
That looks like an invalid URL to me from an api/v1/drives perspective
our code expects that you must provide the repo you are referring to in the URL
in particular this is true when you are requesting something with REPO scope
@dlluncor this endpoint works in regression tests, not sure what the difference might be for that vs outside of a regression test
Should I be changing the `@verify_credentials(OAuth2Scope.REPO)` to something different?
did you write your regression test to be both cookie based and auth based?
api/v1/drives/unzip is not a sufficient URL
we should be including the root folder we are trying to unzip or something to that effect, perhaps i missed this detail in the code review
you can see other tests which include the auth and cookie based methods
But the problem is that the root folder we are unzipping is not a folder, it’s a file path, so we can’t do `..../api/v1/drives/vontell/workspace/fs/.../my_zip.zip/unzip`
I could instead have the url be the destination they want to unzip to, would that be better?
And ah yeah looks like my test was cookie-based only
for consistency with our drive API, let’s use the repo_owner/repo_name/ etc corresponding to the source directory
